results.title: A Book by it's cover
results.creator_credit: Iowa State University Film Production Unit
results.brief_description: The embellishment of a book is a dying art. This film demonstrates how books are bound with leather binding - showing the handling, tooling and decoration with gold leaf. This decorative, traditional craft is an expensive and slow process and most suitable for collector’s items. No other credits available.

results.title: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Selma H. Fraiberg and University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center
results.brief_description: Follows a blind and a sighted child through the sensori-motor period during the first year of life in an attempt to answer the following questions. How is this crucial period affected when one of the major senses is lacking? What are the pathways of progress for the blind infant? What are the limits set by his handicap?

results.title: Music for the movies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
Aaron Copland, famed American composer-pianist, narrates and conducts his own film musical scores. Copland has chosen music from “Red Pony”, “Our Town” and “Something Wild” as a framework in which to show the purpose and meaning of background scores for motion pictures. Featuring the New York Philharmonic.

group_siblings.title: A Birthday tribute to Shostakovich
group_siblings.creator_credit: Roger Englander and C B S Productions

results.title: A Birthday tribute to Shostakovich
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander and C B S Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
To celebrate the birthday of a famous Russian composer, Shostakovich, the New York Philharmonic under Leonard Bernstein plays part of the former’s Symphony No 7 (the Leningrad Symphony). This is followed by all of Symphony No 9. Bernstein also gives a sound illustrated lesson in musical theory.

results.title: A Big hand for everyone
results.brief_description: The average man, in ignorance and confusion, has an optimistic view of his future. The expert, wrapped in his knowledge and expertise, is pessimistic. It is this disparity of belief that the political cartoonist and humorist, Bruce Petty, animates in his film. Petty sees the world and its problems as complex. He shows Man as a lonely figure on a unicycle, pedalling hard towards disaster. Awards: Golden Reel Award, AFI Awards 1971.

results.title: A Bell for Ursli
results.brief_description: This live action film takes place in the Canton of Grisons in Switzerland and illustrates an old custom; when spring comes the village boys chase away the winter with bells, rattles and cracking whips. Ursli, unhappy with his tiny bell, remembers a big bell in his father’s chalet high above the timber-line and sets off to get it.

results.title: A Bay in the balance
results.brief_description: In 1972, the Victorian Government responded to a conservation campaign and further industrial development in Westernport was halted. A major scientific study was initiated to examine how the relatively undeveloped bay functions and what future plans should be.
